column4: Whenever I try to enter any of the administrative features in Gnome, I get a password prompt, I enter the password, and nothing happens. Tried both the regular user password and the root password.
try in a terminal: gksudo synaptic
running gksudo synaptic produces a password prompt, I enter the password, and nothing happens.
did you do a server or expert install?
right, sudo addgroup --system admin && sudo adduser willy admin
and use the standard sudoers file, see http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/5013
After running the commands you gave me, and editing the sudoers file so it matches the one in the example, I still get nothing happening.
does 'id' say you're in the 'admin' group?
then something went wrong with the earlier commands
the group admin does not exist in the /etc/group file
then let's go the quick route
